article.title: Research Libraries and Technology
article.author: Fussler, H.H.
article.text: The focus of the report is primarily upon the problems of the large, university, research-oriented library. It is here that one finds the most difficult resource-access and bibliographical control problems. If one can significantly improve both of these operations for the large, research-oriented institutions, there are likely to be direct or indirect benefits for the smaller library, while the reverse situation is much less likely.
